column2: Bestow one of your spare Mech Suits to [Root.GetFirstName].
This is a Red Fighter, common on the battlefields of Mars. They give the user a tactical edge and greater defense but are often made of shoddy material.

The AP-6 STRIKER is the most advanced Mech Suit designed by Spacer engineers.Equipped with guns and cannons unfamiliar to the people of Mars, it has devastating effect on the battlefield. However, it can be as dangerous to the pilot as to his foe...
This is a Zhao Ranger Mech Suit designed Spacer engineers.It is equipped with an autocannon and automatic defensive capabilities.
You need a Commander Key in order to pilot a Zhao Ranger or AP-6 STRIKER Mech Suit. The suits will not activate without one.
This character can pilot Armord Mech Suits
Purchase a standard Combat Mech Suit
Purchase a lower end Combat Mech Suit
Consult your Marshal about purchasing a high end Mech Suit
You have purchased a piloting license and are now authorized to pilot a Combat Mech Suit. Be careful!

You have commisioned your Spymaster with the task of finding and purchasing a Combat Mech Suit for your own personal use. There are many Zhao Rangers on the market, and for the right price you have acquired one for yourself. You anxiously await its delivery to you at the gates of [Root.Capital.GetName], but even still as it arrives you can't help but almost faint. Two stories tall, wide, golden, with claws the size of an ox and creaking ungodly noises from its orifices, your Zhao Ranger Mech Suit is as fearsome as you had hoped it would look.

You meet your contact, a Cetinese trader with a mechanic eye, at a hangar not too far from your capital. "They're masterworks, all. You can't go wrong," he says as he unveils his 'toys' for you to see. He presents to you a tall metal hulk, a beastly giant iron almost in the shape of a man, its exterior harder than any sword you've felt.

The AP-6 STRIKER is the most advanced Mech Suit made with the material available on Mars. Its defensive capabilities and foreign armaments make it impossible to defeat on the battlefield. You have invested a lot of gold and time, and now your STRIKER has finally arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName].
You have entrusted your spare Mech Suit to [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. "Thank you," [Root.GetSheHe] says, bowing to express [Root.GetHerHis] gratitude.
Hopefully, they don't don't use it against me...

With each engagement you get better and better at fighting inside your Mech suit. However, Piloting an Armored Mech Suit is heavily taxing on the human body. Due to having to connect to the pilot's spine every use, over time the Mech Suit can kill its pilot.
Piloting your Mech Suit takes a toll on your health.
You are unaffected by your suit's life draining mechanics
I am one with my Machine!
Unlike most pilots, you are unaffected by the drawbacks of extensive fighting. You are more closely bonded with your Mech Suit.
This character handles their Mech Suit well.

As an Emperor, it simply will not do to pilot a standard Mech Suit like every other Commander. No, you have tasked your researchers with developing an AP-6 STRIKER. At last, their construction is complete and you can now pilot her yourself if you can handle it...
Your Mech Suit is scrapped to build an AP-6 STRIKER
